task_description: Facing the building to your West (approx. 271°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: To see the full height of the main building, I need to look up to capture its upper portion, so I'll rotate the camera upward with a pitch delta of 30 degrees.
My current heading is 0°N, but the target building is to the West (271°), so I need to rotate left 90 degrees to face the correct direction and view the target building.
I am now facing the target building (West direction), so I need to look up to see the full height of the structure from ground to roof; I'll rotate the camera upward with a pitch delta of 30 degrees.
My current heading is 0°N, which is not facing the target building (West), so I need to rotate left 90 degrees to reorient to 270°W and view the target structure.
I am facing the target building (West direction) with a 0° pitch, so I need to look up by rotating the camera upward 30 degrees to capture the upper portion of the building and see its full height.
I need to face the target west building and look up to see its full height, so I will rotate left 90 degrees to set my heading to 270°W and up 30 degrees to view the upper portion of the structure.
I can now see the full target building from ground to roof; estimating based on typical floor heights (3 meters per floor) and counting ~8 visible floors, the total height is approximately 24 meters.
